ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Estimation of generalized linear models with correlated/clustered observations by use of generalized estimating equations (GEE). See e.g. Halekoh and Højsgaard, (2005, <doi:10.18637/jss.v015.i02>), for details. Several types of clustering are supported, including exchangeable variance structures, AR1 structures, M-dependent, user-specified variance structures and more. The model fitting computations are performed using modified code from the 'geeM' package, while the interface and output objects have been written to resemble the 'geepack' package. The package also contains additional tools for working with and inspecting results from the 'geepack' package, e.g. a 'confint' method for 'geeglm' objects from 'geepack'.

Estimation of generalized linear models with correlated/clustered observations by use of generalized estimating equations (GEE). See e.g. Halekoh and Højsgaard, (2005, <doi:10.18637/jss.v015.i02>), for details. Several types of clustering are supported, including exchangeable variance structures, AR1 structures, M-dependent, user-specified variance structures and more. The model fitting computations are performed using modified code from the 'geeM' package, while the interface and output objects have been written to resemble the 'geepack' package. The package also contains additional tools for working with and inspecting results from the 'geepack' package, e.g. a 'confint' method for 'geeglm' objects from 'geepack'.

name: r-geeasy
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.3' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-geeasy
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/geeasy_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/geeasy/geeasy_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 25c85ed144fa7c22dbbb3c05d55890c5f73563ee84503983b6ef2bc6ab1e0ba2

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mess
    - r-matrix
    - r-geem
    - r-geepack
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lme4
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mess
    - r-matrix
    - r-geem
    - r-geepack
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lme4

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('geeasy')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('geeasy')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=geeasy
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: "Estimation of generalized linear models with correlated/clustered observations by
    use of generalized estimating equations (GEE). See e.g. Halekoh and H\xF8jsgaard,
    (2005, <doi:10.18637/jss.v015.i02>), for details. Several types of clustering are
    supported, including exchangeable variance structures, AR1 structures, M-dependent,
    user-specified variance structures and more. The model fitting computations are
    performed using modified code from the 'geeM' package, while the interface and output
    objects have been written to resemble the 'geepack' package. The package also contains
    additional tools for working with and inspecting results from the 'geepack' package,
    e.g. a 'confint' method for 'geeglm' objects from 'geepack'."
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - funnell

# Package: geeasy
# Type: Package
# Title: Solve Generalized Estimating Equations for Clustered Data
# Version: 0.1.3
# Authors@R: c(person("Anne Helby", "Petersen", role = c("aut"), email = "ahpe@sund.ku.dk"), person("Lee", "McDaniel", role = "aut", comment = "Author of geeM"), person("Claus", "Ekstrm", role = "ctb", comment = "Wrote code for drop1 methods"), person("Sren", "Hjsgaard", role = c("aut", "cre"), email="sorenh@math.aau.dk", comment = "Author of geepack"))
# Maintainer: Sren Hjsgaard <sorenh@math.aau.dk>
# Depends: geepack, stats
# Imports: ggplot2, geeM, lme4, methods, Matrix, MESS
# Suggests: testthat, MuMIn
# Description: Estimation of generalized linear models with correlated/clustered observations by use of generalized estimating equations (GEE). See e.g. Halekoh and Hjsgaard, (2005, <doi:10.18637/jss.v015.i02>), for details. Several types of clustering are supported, including exchangeable variance structures, AR1 structures, M-dependent, user-specified variance structures and more. The model fitting computations are performed using modified code from the 'geeM' package, while the interface and output objects have been written to resemble the 'geepack' package. The package also contains additional tools for working with and inspecting results from the 'geepack' package, e.g. a 'confint' method for 'geeglm' objects from 'geepack'.

# RoxygenNote: 7.3.2
# Encoding: UTF-8
# Language: en-US
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2025-07-23 07:26:11 UTC; sorenh
# Author: Anne Helby Petersen [aut], Lee McDaniel [aut] (Author of geeM), Claus Ekstrm [ctb] (Wrote code for drop1 methods), Sren Hjsgaard [aut, cre] (Author of geepack)
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2025-07-23 07:50:09 UTC
